HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy

HDG.LP.content: [p.172 who is the Abgeschiedene (the departed one)?] the dead one (Gestorbene) lives in his grave, the dead one is the madman (Wahnsinnige) > madness not as mental illness, he is of another mind, taken his way in another direction, his madness “gentle,” his mind pursues a greater stillness
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [p.172 who is the Abgeschiedene (the departed one)?] the dead one (Gestorbene) lives in his grave, the dead one is the madman (Wahnsinnige) > madness not as mental illness, he is of another mind, taken his way in another direction, his madness “gentle,” his mind pursues a greater stillness

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

HDG.LP.content: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]

HDG.LP.content: apartness not the desolation (Ödnis) of departed dead > stranger measures off (durchmisst) the parting (Abschied) from previous Geschlecht [mankind hitherto], he is underway on a path (Pfad) > departed, the stranger is set apart, one of the select (Erlesenen)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: apartness not the desolation (Ödnis) of departed dead > stranger measures off (durchmisst) the parting (Abschied) from previous Geschlecht [mankind hitherto], he is underway on a path (Pfad) > departed, the stranger is set apart, one of the select (Erlesenen)
